messages: 5ab3b9ae38a4e155c0c676c21e71412c (02:00): Hello everybody ....
5ab3b9ae38a4e155c0c676c21e71412c (02:05): I would like to have your advises regarding the technologies to set up for an ethernet LAN in a private flat
ae2723c5c3c9da84b0c32669c7b01e60 (02:05): practically immaterial...
5ab3b9ae38a4e155c0c676c21e71412c (02:06): (ask me to precise if needed I'm french ;) )
ae2723c5c3c9da84b0c32669c7b01e60 (02:06): what's the problem?
5ab3b9ae38a4e155c0c676c21e71412c (02:07): I live in a flat, where there is only students
a517096ca4327d4179146e866a96e672 (02:07): Triffid_Hunter, are you there?
5ab3b9ae38a4e155c0c676c21e71412c (02:07): and we would like to share internet connections
5ab3b9ae38a4e155c0c676c21e71412c (02:09): We have decided to set up a wired LAN (if possible RJ45) but my question is, is it possible to make it with only one line and if so will it be fast enough ?
ae2723c5c3c9da84b0c32669c7b01e60 (02:09): Cilyan, what kind of connection do you have? DSL?
ae2723c5c3c9da84b0c32669c7b01e60 (02:10): yes, of course, just use a router
ae2723c5c3c9da84b0c32669c7b01e60 (02:10): you can get a combined DSL modem/router or just put one downstream
ae2723c5c3c9da84b0c32669c7b01e60 (02:10): it will multiplex the connection
5ab3b9ae38a4e155c0c676c21e71412c (02:12): We have already it, and last year, we used to connect each other on the router
5ab3b9ae38a4e155c0c676c21e71412c (02:14): But as the rooms are separated, we put the lines from one window to another by the outside
5ab3b9ae38a4e155c0c676c21e71412c (02:15): But the director found it very ugly all these lines on the outside of the flat and decided to remove them and put them in the inside
5ab3b9ae38a4e155c0c676c21e71412c (02:16): So we have to put them... arg! english ... sorry juste wait a minute '^^

5ab3b9ae38a4e155c0c676c21e71412c (02:18): thx google :p... So we have to put the line in the electric sheath and as the flat is long, it will be great if we were able to put just on line through the sheath
849fd989f7b4965e4d6097592727b44a (02:19): Mmmmm new machine is here and fassssssstttt
ae2723c5c3c9da84b0c32669c7b01e60 (02:21): Cilyan, if you use an active hub or two (pretty cheap), it will work
5ab3b9ae38a4e155c0c676c21e71412c (02:22): "active hub" you mean something to repeat signal ?
5ab3b9ae38a4e155c0c676c21e71412c (02:22): (when the line is too long?)
ae2723c5c3c9da84b0c32669c7b01e60 (02:23): it's not a repeater but another kind of multiplexer
ae2723c5c3c9da84b0c32669c7b01e60 (02:23): just look for a "hub" (or "switch", which is a little fancier)
5ab3b9ae38a4e155c0c676c21e71412c (02:24): Ah ... (I know what hub or switch mean, but I wasn't sure of the translation :p)
5ab3b9ae38a4e155c0c676c21e71412c (02:24): Ok, but with this, I will have many lines
ae2723c5c3c9da84b0c32669c7b01e60 (02:25): only downstream
ac4af998947102f0adce14f13d55438a (02:26): Cilyan: have you looked into wireless options?
5ab3b9ae38a4e155c0c676c21e71412c (02:28): jzono1: Walls are too big, wireless doesn't go through more than 3 rooms
ac4af998947102f0adce14f13d55438a (02:31): just grab one big badass antenna for the router
5ab3b9ae38a4e155c0c676c21e71412c (02:33): hmm, I'm afraid the cost would be too high ...
5ab3b9ae38a4e155c0c676c21e71412c (02:38): ok, just one more question: if I put hubs on the network, which bitrate will I reach if I connect together about 15 computers ?
5ab3b9ae38a4e155c0c676c21e71412c (02:38): (hubs, not switches)
ae2723c5c3c9da84b0c32669c7b01e60 (02:39): hubs limit your bandwidth more than switches, but will still probably be faster than your DSL uplink
5ab3b9ae38a4e155c0c676c21e71412c (02:39): Sure, but for file sharing ?
5ab3b9ae38a4e155c0c676c21e71412c (02:40): For example with a wireless link, the link is so bad that a film (650Mo) take 2h30' to donwload
ae2723c5c3c9da84b0c32669c7b01e60 (02:41): Cilyan, uplink is always the bottleneck
ae2723c5c3c9da84b0c32669c7b01e60 (02:41): there is no way you can afford an internet connection as fast as your LAN would be
c3a0e27b463971793444b182b3738834 (02:41): brick, sometimes a poor wifi connection makes it wrose
5ab3b9ae38a4e155c0c676c21e71412c (02:42): no, I talk about computer to computer inside the LAN
ae2723c5c3c9da84b0c32669c7b01e60 (02:42): use switches if you are worried about it
5ab3b9ae38a4e155c0c676c21e71412c (02:42): without going through internet connection
ae2723c5c3c9da84b0c32669c7b01e60 (02:42): 100baseT switch is way, way fast enough
5ab3b9ae38a4e155c0c676c21e71412c (02:44): ok... but problem stay if all connections goes trough on line ....
ae2723c5c3c9da84b0c32669c7b01e60 (02:46): look, either try it or don't
5ab3b9ae38a4e155c0c676c21e71412c (02:47): yes, you're right ...
5ab3b9ae38a4e155c0c676c21e71412c (02:48): When there is switches on the line, more than one computer can talk on medias on different sides of the switch or is it forbidden ? (Collision Detection)
ac4af998947102f0adce14f13d55438a (02:48): Cilyan: you can make it go through one line if you use a switch for every second computer
ac4af998947102f0adce14f13d55438a (02:48): (a standard cat5 cable has enough leads for two 100mbit links)
ac4af998947102f0adce14f13d55438a (02:49): Cilyan: not forbidden
5ab3b9ae38a4e155c0c676c21e71412c (02:49): jzono1: yes, that's what I think to do, but I wonder if 15 computer won't be too much for just one link
5ab3b9ae38a4e155c0c676c21e71412c (02:50): Ok... I think that's all ^^
ac4af998947102f0adce14f13d55438a (02:50): it will give plenty enough bandwidth
5ab3b9ae38a4e155c0c676c21e71412c (02:50): Thank you very much (you're very patient you know :p)
ac4af998947102f0adce14f13d55438a (02:51): the best solution would be multiple cat5s and one big gigabit switch
5ab3b9ae38a4e155c0c676c21e71412c (02:52): Oh, just to finish, is it possible to link two switches with two lines ?
5ab3b9ae38a4e155c0c676c21e71412c (02:52): or is it dangerous ?
ac4af998947102f0adce14f13d55438a (02:53): it's silly
5ab3b9ae38a4e155c0c676c21e71412c (02:54): thanks a lot
ac4af998947102f0adce14f13d55438a (02:54): 100mbit is plenty enough for 15 computers
5ab3b9ae38a4e155c0c676c21e71412c (02:54): Have a good ... uh ... for me it's night :)
ac4af998947102f0adce14f13d55438a (02:55): same here
5ab3b9ae38a4e155c0c676c21e71412c (02:55): So have a good night :)
ac4af998947102f0adce14f13d55438a (02:55): i've been to lanparties where there's been 30-40 computers connected to a 100mbit net
5ab3b9ae38a4e155c0c676c21e71412c (02:55): ok, I'll notice :)
5018e22d0965bb7bacc85d6ebb35c8f5 (03:16): is there a core duo e6700 or e6600 notebook yet ?
3b5bb8a3bd0820db7a74f2482e91265c (03:26): hmm ... does nForce4 really have 10 USB 2.0 ports, or does it actually have some 1.1 only ports?
